intro: Menodora trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifid (three-lobed) leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Its vines can grow up to several meters long, often climbing or trailing along the ground. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
